sourcing.instructions: B (Boric Acid): Chemical supply stores or online retailers. Fe (Iron Powder): Metal supply shops or online. In (Indium Powder): Specialty metal suppliers. O (Oxygen): Ambient air (from reaction). Sb (Antimony Powder): Chemical supply stores or online.
steps: B (Boric Acid): Chemical supply stores or online retailers. Fe (Iron Powder): Metal supply shops or online. In (Indium Powder): Specialty metal suppliers. O (Oxygen): Ambient air (from reaction). Sb (Antimony Powder): Chemical supply stores or online.

1. Weigh each ingredient precisely using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, mix B, Fe, In, Sb thoroughly using a spatula. 3. Gradually add O (as part of the chemical reaction) while stirring to ensure even distribution.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient precisely using an analytical balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, mix B, Fe, In, Sb thoroughly using a spatula. 3. Gradually add O (as part of the chemical reaction) while stirring to ensure even distribution.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixture to a crucible. 2. Heat in a muffle furnace to 800°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure full reaction and formation of the desired compound.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixture to a crucible. 2. Heat in a muffle furnace to 800°C. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure full reaction and formation of the desired compound.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace during cooling to prevent contamination.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace during cooling to prevent contamination.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the sample from the crucible. 2. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth any rough edges. 3. If desired, seal the surface with a clear epoxy resin for added durability. Allow 24 hours for the resin to cure.
